Notes: The Lawrence County Archives opened to the public in 1991.  It is a project of the Lawrence County Historical Commission Incorporated and is located in the historic Bank of Moulton Building.  The primary focus of the archives is the acquisition, restoration, preservation, duplication and storage of records generated by county offices prior to 1920.  These include those of the Chancery/Circuit Court, Orphans/Probate Court, Commission Court, Sheriff's office, Taxation offices, Board of Education, and the Board of Registrars.  In addition, the archives accepts family histories and copies of family bible records to assist the public in historical and genealogical research.  The archives does not solicit artifacts.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
